subject: Re: [junit] How do I extend the TestSuite
msgSnippet: I may be missing your point, but why not just extend TestSuite and override the addTest() method? -jason ... Keep it simple... (1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians
messageBody:
I may be missing your point, but why not just extend TestSuite and override the
addTest() method?

-jason

--- gavinlas <gavinlas@...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I would like to have control over the test cases and tests that are
> added to a TestSuite.
>
> I could extend the TestSuite or I could manually add test cases.
> However, I would like to use my new test suite with the existing
> JUnit tools (like SwingRunner, textRunner, etc). These tools seem to
> instantiate a TestSuite.
>
> Any idea how I can fit my new test suite class into this architecture.
>
> Thanks
>
>


=====
-----------------------------------------
Keep it simple...
(1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
